item.title: Testing deletion vectors
item.description: At my current job I need to delta with multibillion data files. I process the telemetry from over 200,000 chargers that send telemetry over

item.title: Repairing metadata unity catalog
item.description: I’ve been subscribed to https://www.dataengineeringweekly.com/p/data-engineering-weekly-148 for years. This last number included several on-call posts on Medium. I found these quite useful. Today, I got an alert from Metaplane that a cost monitor dashboard was out of date. I checked the processes, and everything was fine. I ran a query to check the freshness of the data and it was ok too. Metaplane checks our delta table freshness by querying the table information available in the Unity Catalog.

item.title: Duplicates with delta, how can it be?
item.description: Long time without writing! On highlights: I left my job at Schwarz It in December last year, and now I’m a full-time employee at Wallbox! I’m really happy with my new job, and I’ve experienced interesting stuff. This one was just one of these strange cases where you start doubting the compiler. Context One of my main tables represents sensor measures from our chargers with millisecond precision. The numbers are quite high, we are talking over 2 billion rows per day.
